resources.string: In Android Oreo (and many versions before it), the location settings screen had a Mode option on top, which unveiled three options: High accuracy (GPS + WiFi + Bluetooth + mobile networks), Battery saving (WiFi + Bluetooth + mobile networks, but no battery-sucking GPS), and Device only (GPS).But in Android P the Mode option is gone. There\'s no equivalent to Battery saving, so you can\'t turn off the GPS and rely on quasi-accurate location without sucking down your battery. \nThis software will add a tile at Quick Setting to switch the GPS ON/OFF.
If you want to Uninstall.Please Press the Quick Settings Tile and click Uninstall.
Auto switch off GPS after system boot
